title: Stylish Mercure Escape in the Heart of Launceston with Daily Breakfast & Nightly Drinks
description:
Discover Launceston's wild beauty, thriving food scene and UNESCO World Heritage-listed wonders from your stylish city launchpad, Mercure Launceston. Experience ultimate comfort in your recently refurbished room, complete with plush bedding, and indulge in exceptional regional cuisine at the hotel's stylish restaurant, Titanium Bar and Bistro.

You'll be perfectly positioned for exploring the very best of Launceston's city sights, from Boag's Brewery to the stunning Cataract Gorge, and within an easy road trip of the Apple Isle's northern delights, including the picturesque Tamar Valley, just a 30-minute drive away. Whether you're in need of a short break in a vibrant city or looking for an ideal launchpad for longer adventures, Mercure Launceston is an idyllic addition to any Tasmanian itinerary.

title: Tasmania: 3-Day Derby Mountain Biking Adventure with Daily Breakfast & Floating Sauna Experience
description:
Gear up for the ride of your life on this unmissable three-day small-group mountain biking adventure (max. seven guests) and churn up some serious dirt along Derby's world-class trails.

Home to the terrain that mountain bikers dream of, Derby features 120km of unrivalled cycling territory - suitable for all riders from novice to pro-level - looped around a natural bowl of breathtaking nature. Warm up your wheels on the rolling Rusty Crusty or get straight to grips with Flickity Sticks where boulders, berms and intense descents await. Put some serious air between you and the earth at Air-Ya-Garn or pedal past panoramic views of the town on the steep and technical Trouty. Drive an hour east and you'll reach the equally renowned Blue Tier, home to a mesmerising network of tracks that swerve and curve through myrtle forest. Ready for a challenge? Heighten your senses with a nighttime ride and zoom through the bush trail with the soundscape of nocturnal creatures and a 1,100-lumen mountain bike light leading the way.

Enjoy top-of-the-range transport including a custom-built bike trailer, two nights in purpose-designed boutique accommodation and personalised trail recommendations to cater to your individual skillset - ensuring you get the most out of your epic adventure. Keep your legs pumping with a daily hamper of delicious goodies, treat yourself with a one-time dinner prepared in-house by an expert chef from Kitchen 7216 and after a final ride, take a dip in the wood-fired Floating Sauna Lake Derby before plunging into the adjacent icy lake - winter is no exception.

**Your package includes:**

- Relax with return transfers from Launceston Airport (LST) including a custom-built bike trailer
- Cosy up with two nights in a self-contained unit at Tin Mountain, Derby
- Fuel up for daily adventures with a generous daily breakfast hamper, lunches and snacks
- Indulge in a one-time evening meal per person prepared by an expert chef from Kitchen 7216
- Unwind after a day on the trails with a one-time pass to wood-fired Floating Sauna Lake Derby
- Enjoy personalised trail recommendations based on your individual riding style

**Travelling as a group?** Choose a package for two, three or four guests and share a self-contained unit at Tin Mountain.

**Need bike hire?** Select a package with bike hire included. See Fine Print for guidance on groups.

title: Tasmanian Escape at The Sebel Launceston
description: Uncover the charms of Launceston with two nights including breakfast staying in a self-contained apartment in the heart of the city at The Sebel. One of Australia's oldest cities and known for its boutique producers, fresh seafood restaurants, stylish cocktail bars and restaurants, art gallery, and the spectacular Cataract Gorge, Launceston is a food and culture lover’s dream destination. Just outside the city you’ll find the vineyards and wineries of the famous Tamar Valley.

title: Apartment Escape at The Sebel Launceston with Daily Breakfast
description: Uncover the charms of Launceston with a chic apartment escape in the heart of the city at The Sebel Launceston. One of Australia's oldest cities and known for its boutique producers, fresh seafood restaurants, stylish cocktail bars and restaurants, art gallery, and the spectacular Cataract Gorge, Launceston is a food and culture lover’s dream destination. Just outside the city you’ll find the vineyards and wineries of the famous Tamar Valley. Your escape includes daily breakfast, a bottle of wine on arrival and a leisurely late 12pm checkout.

title: Modern Mercure Escape in the Heart of Launceston with Daily Breakfast & Nightly Drinks
description:
Discover Launceston's wild beauty, thriving food scene and World Heritage-listed wonders from your stylish city launchpad, Mercure Launceston. Experience ultimate comfort in your recently refurbished room, complete with a plush Posturepedic bed, and indulge in exceptional regional cuisine at the hotel's stylish restaurant, Titanium Bar and Bistro.

You'll be perfectly positioned for exploring the very best of Launceston's city sights, from Boag's Brewery to the stunning Cataract Gorge, and within an easy road trip of the Apple Isle's northern delights, including the picturesque Tamar Valley, just a 30-minute drive away. Whether you're in need of a short break in a vibrant city or looking for an ideal launchpad for longer adventures, Mercure Launceston is an idyllic addition to any Tasmanian itinerary.

**Your handpicked inclusions:**

- Enjoy daily à la carte breakfast curated from local, seasonal produce
- Relax with a nightly drink each (house beer, glass of wine or soft drink) at Titanium Bar and Bistro
- Explore Launceston on your final morning with leisurely 1pm checkout

**Longer stay bonus:** Extend your escape to three or four nights and enjoy A$30 drinks and dining credit per package to spend at Titanium Bar and Bistro; or treat yourself to a stay of five nights or more and receive A$50 drinks and dining credit per package.

vendor_name: Leisure Inn Penny Royal Hotel and Apartments
title: Charming Heritage-Listed Launceston Stay Near Adventure Park
description:
Immerse yourself in the charms of Tasmania's Tamar Valley with a stay at this heritage property, housed in a restored corn mill dating back to the 1840s and perfectly positioned on the banks of the South Esk River. The bustling Launceston CBD, teeming with chic boutiques and quaint cafes, and the picturesque Cataract Gorge Reserve, are both within walking distance and great for urban adventures.

Take delight in the hotel's well-appointed rooms, showcasing heritage elements and convenient amenities. Tuck into modern Australian fare at the onsite Alida restaurant and indulge in family-friendly fun at the nearby Penny Royal Adventure Park where you can go ziplining and rock climbing and enjoy ghost tours.
location_description: Leisure Inn Penny Royal Hotel and Apartments

Whether you're in need of a short break in a vibrant city or looking for an ideal launchpad for longer adventures, Mercure Launceston is an idyllic addition to any Tasmanian itinerary.

title: Modern Central Launceston Apartment Escape with Daily Breakfast
description:
Uncover the charms of Launceston with a stylish apartment escape minutes from the centre of the city at The Sebel Launceston. Ideally positioned in one of Tasmania’s most historic areas and just a short walk from the iconic Cataract Gorge, Harvest Market and Boags Brewery, this northern gem is perfect for couples, families or groups of friends seeking a memorable escape.

Known for its boutique producers, fresh seafood restaurants, modern cocktail bars and restaurants, trendy art gallery, and spectacular landscapes that hug the city, Launceston is a feast for the senses and a dream destination for food and culture lovers. Just outside the city, you’ll find the vineyards and wineries of the Tamar Valley (home to more than 30 wineries). After filling your days exploring this idyllic corner of Tasmania, there’s no better place to recalibrate than your stylish, self-contained apartment. Choose from one or two-bedroom options complete with a kitchenette and furnished balcony where you can soak up city views from the comfort of your own space. For moments when you need to raise your heart rate, head to the sleek fitness centre, and for a uniquely Tasmanian culinary experience, be sure to visit the onsite Bluestone Bar & Kitchen.

title: Laidback Escape in the Heart of Launceston with Daily Breakfast
description:
Experience Launceston's exciting dining scene and World Heritage-listed wonders from Coach House Launceston, a centrally-located hotel offering views over the city and Tamar River Valley. Enjoy complimentary parking before checking in to your beautifully appointed room complete with all the creature comforts, then take the short five-minute stroll into town to immerse yourself in the charms of one of Australia's best-preserved cityscapes.

You'll be perfectly positioned for exploring the very best of Launceston's city sights, from James Boag Brewery to the stunning Cataract Gorge, and within an easy road trip of the Apple Isle's northern delights, including the picturesque Tamar Valley, just a 30-minute drive away. Whether you're in need of a short break in a vibrant city or looking for an ideal launchpad for longer adventures, Coach House Launceston is an idyllic addition to any Tasmanian itinerary.

title: Elegant Launceston Heritage Escape with Daily Breakfast & Late Checkout
description:
Discover the wild beauty and World Heritage-listed wonders of the Apple Isle from the gorgeous The Cornwall Historic Hotel in Launceston, believed to be the oldest brick building in Tasmania and location of the historic meeting which led to the settlement of Melbourne.

Featuring a collection of historic, fully refurbished rooms with spacious ensuites and modern amenities, this family-friendly property is a cosy home-away-from-home. Let The Cornwall Historic Hotel be your launchpad as you discover Tasmania's fertile northern region, where colonial and Victorian architecture neighbour blossoming food and coffee spots, and late-19th-century homes dot the suburbs. The hotel is ideally located within easy reach of top attractions such as the James Boag's Brewery, The Mall, City Park and University of Tasmania Stadium, leaving you spoilt for choice for what to do. Days can be enjoyed in the lush countryside that surrounds the city, sipping field-blended wines from renowned cellar doors or learning of 'Launnie's' nature and storied history. Follow the hint of lavender a little further afield to Bridestowe Lavender Estate, where you can wander through incredible purple fields (seasonal).

title: Tasmanian Golfing Getaway at Launceston Country Club
description: Picture immaculate golfing greens, elegant rooms, stunning natural scenery and endless activities. All this and more is on offer at Country Club Tasmania, a fantastic escape for couples and families seeking a fun-filled getaway. Stay and play on the 18-hole championship golf course, go on a horse-riding trail or explore Launceston with ease. Includes daily buffet breakfast, guaranteed 1pm late checkout and 20% discount on golfing and horse-riding activities.
offer_address: Country Club Avenue, Prospect Vale, 7250, Tasmania, Australia

title: Laidback Launceston Escape near Tamar Valley with Boxed Breakfast & Late Checkout
description: Soak up the serenity, escape the crowds and enjoy the laidback Launceston lifestyle with a relaxing stay at Nightcap at Riverside Hotel. Tantalisingly close to the city, just moments from the stunning Cataract Gorge Reserve and a 30-minute drive from the acclaimed Tamar Valley, this stylish escape is the perfect base from which to discover the island's treasure trove of natural wonders and outdoor adventures. Savour local flavours at the hotel's bistro with a classic pizza and a hearty pub favourite, or venture out to the nearby Harvest Farmers Market for a taste of the region's fresh produce.
offer_address: 407 West Tamar Highway, Riverside 7250, Tasmania, Australia

title: Launceston Heritage Luxury
description:
There’s something for everyone in Tasmania, and the charming Hotel Grand Chancellor Launceston is the perfect base to explore the northern corner of the Apple Isle. From undulating valleys to breathtaking landscapes, unmissable museums and galleries and a host of exceptional eateries, this enchanting city has it all. During your stay, drop in at the onsite Avenue Restaurant and feast on some of Tasmania’s freshest local produce, while evenings are for a quiet drink at the bar - choose from handcrafted cocktails and Tasmanian wines, ciders, gins and whiskies.

Immerse yourself in the city’s lively yet laidback atmosphere, with the location making it easy to explore. Wander down Brisbane Street Mall, see a live sports match at Aurora Stadium and enjoy a pint and a tour at the James Boag Brewery. Beyond the city, set your sights on the picturesque Tamar Valley and its renowned wineries, charming villages and local producers (think artisanal cheese, fresh cherries and truffles), located just a 30-minute drive away.

title: Stylish Peppers Escape in Launceston's Lively Dockside Precinct
description:
Experience the charm of Launceston with a stylish stay perfectly positioned on the city's vibrant waterfront. On the site of an old dry dock, overlooking the Tamar River Basin and Royal Park, the hotel is just a short stroll from the heart of Launceston's cultural precinct, filled with historic buildings, boutiques and eateries.

Dine at the onsite restaurant, Mudbar, offering a fusion of Asian and modern Australian cuisine, or explore the nearby Cataract Gorge, a natural wonderland of walking trails, gardens and wildlife. The hotel is also a short drive from the Tamar Valley wine region, home to some of Tasmania's finest vineyards.

title: Tasmania Country Retreat in Launceston with Onsite Dining & Indoor Pool
description:
Picture a blend of sprawling resort gardens, immaculate golfing greens, natural scenery and endless activities set across 300 acres of lush parkland. All this and more awaits at this countryside resort, making it the ultimate destination for the perfect combination of adventure and relaxation.

Indulge to the max at the onsite pool and sauna, spot wildlife right from your cosy room or suite, explore scenic horse-riding trails or easily venture into the heart of Launceston for a day of discovery. At Country Club Tasmania, everything you need is within reach.
offer_address: Country Club Avenue, Prospect Vale, Tasmania 7250, Australia

title: Art-Deco Inspired Launceston Escape with Easy Access to the Tamar Valley & Onsite Restaurant
description: Experience the charm of Tasmania's second-largest city with a stay in the heart of Launceston. You'll be perfectly placed to explore the city's vibrant culinary scene, with renowned eateries and the Tamar Valley wine route, home to over 30 wineries, just a short stroll away. Venture further to discover the breathtaking Cataract Gorge Reserve or the Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery. Back at the hotel, indulge in locally sourced cuisine at the onsite restaurant, The Charles, or relax in the comfort of your stylishly appointed rooms.

title: Heritage Escape in the Heart of Launceston
description:
Experience Tasmania’s lush valleys, gourmet produce and breathtaking landscapes from your base at Hotel Grand Chancellor Launceston, a charming 4.5-star hotel with an iconic heritage façade. During your stay, drop in at the onsite Avenue Restaurant and feast on some of Tasmania’s freshest local produce, while evenings are for a quiet drink at the bar - choose from handcrafted cocktails and Tasmanian wines, ciders, gins and whiskies.

You’re perfectly placed to explore the city and its excellent eateries, shops and cafés. Take a stroll down Brisbane Street Mall, see a live sports match at Aurora Stadium and enjoy a pint and a tour at James Boag's Brewery. What’s more, the picturesque Tamar Valley and its renowned wineries, charming villages and local producers (think artisanal cheese, fresh cherries and truffles), is just a 30-minute drive away.

title: Idyllic Waterfront Launceston Escape in Heritage Landmark Building with Onsite Restaurant
description:
Revel in the fusion of history and modern luxury at this lavish hotel housed in a superbly converted series of 1960s grain silos and majestically positioned on the banks of the Tamar River in Launceston's Inveresk precinct. Relax and unwind in the sophisticated rooms designed within the historical silos and savour farm-to-table dining at the Grain of the Silos restaurant.

Overlooking Cataract Gorge, Seaport and Royal Park, the nine-storey hotel is a stone's throw from the heart of Launceston. Take a leisurely walk along the riverfront boardwalk, visit the nearby Queen Victoria Museum, or return to your abode and pamper yourself with restorative treatments at the Silo Day Spa.
offer_address: 89 To 91 Lindsay Street, Launceston, Tasmania 7248, Australia

title: Classic Launceston Stay near Historic City Park with Onsite Bar & Bistro
description:
Explore the rich history and vibrant culture of Tasmania with a stay at this centrally located Launceston property. This elegant hotel is perfectly positioned in the heart of Launceston, a stone's throw from the city's iconic landmarks, including the Queen Victoria Museum at Inveresk and the hiking trails of Cataract Gorge. Plus, the Tamar Valley wine region is just a 30-minute drive away.

Back at the hotel, enjoy a drink at the Titanium Bar & Bistro or indulge in a gourmet meal cooked to perfection. The hotel is also a neighbour to the marvellous City Park so take advantage and indulge in a leisurely stroll.
